sub_title: Global Product Safety Competence Lead/Coordinator at ASML
summary:
As a determined and go-getter person, I like to utilize my work experience, educational background and learning desire in a leading managerial position.  

Please note that testimony letters (Zeugnis) from the previous companies (Bosch, in German) and Magna Powertrain is available in the attachments.

profile_positions.description:
- Coordinating the 10 product safety risk areas (gas, electrical, high pressure, radiation, material and substances, mechanical safety, etc.)
- Responsible from functional safety management
- Aligning with global quality, system engineering, architects, subject matter experts on safety in design 
- Developing D&E product safety competences by setting regulatory and compliance requirements
- Defining compliance validation processes and reports 
- Networking within the company, industry peers and authorities on legislation and implementation
- Reporting on compliance management and maturity
- Participating/supporting compliance improvement initiatives
- Challenging corporate policy against changing regulations
profile_positions.title: Global Product Safety Competence Lead/Coordinator
Head of Safety, Senior Manager Safety Engineering

profile_positions.description:
- Establishing, implementing and maintaining global strategy for competency with industry accepted safety norms/standards/regulations and controls
- Directing/leading engineers and managers (a cross functional team of 10 people) and external stakeholders engaged in program/project
- Leading strategy and deployment in terms of functional safety, safety of the intended functionality, data safety, AI Safety and UI/UX Safety
- Ensuring security-aware process and product safety for all TomTom products brought to market
- Improving interfaces regarding safety among TomTom and stakeholders
- Driving the Safety awareness/culture and approach within TomTom, across organizational boundaries and with senior management
- Establishing the plans for the development of System Elements Out of Context for all critical components
profile_positions.title: Head of Safety

profile_positions.description:
- Directing engineers and managers (a cross functional team of 8 people working in Poland, Germany and the Netherlands) and external stakeholders (including Functional Safety consultants) engaged in program and project work
- Leading strategy and deployment in terms of functional safety, safety of the intended functionality, cybersecurity and quality framework.
- Improving interfaces regarding functional safety and cybersecurity between the AD unit and other units of the company
- Ensuring the process (including the necessary guidelines and templates) and product safety for all PU AD products brought to market regarding ISO 26262 and ISO/PAS 21448. 
- Ensuring PU AD products brought to market comply with the cybersecurity (e.g. ISO 21434) and privacy (e.g. GDPR) state of the art including the related policies, guidelines and practices;  involving liaising with the Corporate Security team 
- Driving the Functional Safety awareness and approach within the AD unit and across organizational boundaries and with senior management
- Assessing and establishing a company-wide safety training program, and contributing to company-wide cybersecurity training
 - Managing, directing and leading the problem resolution and tracking process and providing feedback on status of tracked problems
- Conducting/leading reviews / audits / assessments with the product teams to ensure functional safety as well as quality standards are being met throughout product development cycles
profile_positions.title: Head of Functional Safety/SOTIF, Cybersecurity and QMS, Autonomous Driving, Senior Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Establishing, implementing and maintaining global strategy for competency with ISO 26262:2018.
- Identifying the necessary functional safety processes required for compliance with the state of the art standard (ISO26262) for all functional areas including engineering, operations, quality, program management and all other supporting functions    
- Developing and maintaining the functional safety processes including the necessary guidelines and templates and incorporate them into global product creation system.
- Improving Interfaces regarding functional safety among the divisions of Magna Powertrain
- Couch and lead the functional safety engineers in the customer programs ISO 26262 compliance activities
- Assessing and establishing a global training program.
- Presenting ISO 26262 Trainings company wide.
- Establishing internal assessment, audits and confirmation reviews.
- Establishing the plans for the development of System Elements Out of Context for all critical components
- Establishing, coordination and fulfillment of the Guidelines for SW Tool Qualifications
- Coordination of Generic HARAs supported by vehicle testing and simulations
- Increasing awareness about cybersecurity
- Carrying out cybersecurity trainings company-wide
